item.title: Will Not Support Israeli Strike On Iran's Nuclear Sites, Says Joe Biden
item.description: US President Joe Biden said on Wednesday that he would not support any Israeli strike on Iran's nuclear sites in response to its missile attack and urged Israel to act "proportionally."

item.title: Explained: How Significant Is Russia's Capture Of Ukraine's Vuhledar?
item.description: Russian troops are in complete control of the town of Vuhledar in Ukraine's eastern Donetsk region that has resisted Russian assaults for more than two years, the SHOT Telegram channel and pro-Russian war bloggers said on Wednesday.

item.title: "Will Have A Stronger Response" If Israel Retaliates: Iran President
item.description: President Masoud Pezeshkian insisted Wednesday that Iran was "not looking for war" but pledged a stronger response if Israel retaliates for its missile attack.

item.title: Hurricane Helene devastates Southeastern US: Biden deploys 1,000 troops for relief efforts
item.description: President Joe Biden has sent 1,000 active-duty soldiers to aid relief efforts in the southeastern US after Hurricane Helene caused over 175 deaths and severe flooding in states like North Carolina and Tennessee. Search teams struggle to reach remote areas, and rebuilding may take years. Survivors can apply for federal assistance to address ongoing challenges.

item.title: Eight Israeli soldiers killed in clashes with Hezbollah in Lebanon
item.description:
Casualties during heavy fighting in border areas come days after Israel launched ground incursion

  • Middle East crisis – latest news updates

Eight Israeli soldiers have been killed and a number of others wounded in three exchanges with Hezbollah in heavy fighting inside Lebanon.

The largest group of soldiers, from the commando brigade and including an officer, was involved in a firefight with Hezbollah in a village north of the Israeli border community of Misgav Am, while two other soldiers from the Golani brigade were killed in a separate incident.

Continue reading...

item.title: UK begins evacuating citizens from Lebanon as Israel steps up attacks
item.description:
First charter flight has left Beirut, says David Lammy, with officials planning ‘sea and air’ rescues if situation worsens

  • Middle East crisis – live updates

The UK has laid on a charter flight to evacuate Britons from Lebanon and said it was ready to commission more for the 5,000 nationals and their dependents remaining in the country.

Beirut’s international airport remains open but ministers and officials are preparing contingencies for sea and air rescues via Cyprus should the security situation in Lebanon deteriorate to the point at which commercial flights are stopped.

Continue reading...

item.title: Dozens killed in Israeli strikes and ground operations in southern Gaza
item.description:
At least 70 dead as Israeli strikes against Hamas continue despite attention shifting to Lebanon and Iran

  • Middle East crisis – live updates

More than 70 people have been killed in a series of intensive ground operations and airstrikes by the Israel Defense Forces in southern Gaza, Palestinian medical officials said on Wednesday.

Israel has continued to strike what it says are militant targets across Gaza nearly a year after Hamas’s 7 October attack triggered the war in the territory, and even as attention has shifted to Lebanon and Iran.

Continue reading...

item.title: Trump backs out of "60 Minutes" interview after appearing "scattered" and incoherent in Wisconsin
Trump Made a Menacing Election Threat Just Before the V.P. Debate
Passengers line up at Beirut's airport after Israeli airstrikes
